meanings.definition: The tendency to make mistakes or be wrong.
meanings.sent1: Her fallibility was evident when she accidentally deleted the important file.
meanings.sent2: Doctors understand the fallibility of human memory when diagnosing patients.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fallibility, the comedian's mistakes added humor to his performance.
meanings.sent4: The fallibility of the weather forecast made planning outdoor events challenging.
meanings.sent5: The fallibility of the machine's sensors led to inaccurate measurements.

meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of making errors.
meanings.sent1: The team acknowledged the fallibility of their calculations and revised the report.
meanings.sent2: In science, acknowledging fallibility is crucial for continuous improvement.
meanings.sent3: The fallibility of the robot's programming resulted in unexpected behaviors.
meanings.sent4: The fallibility of the security system allowed unauthorized access to the building.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the fallibility of eyewitness testimony is important in legal cases.
